meanings.definition: To partially bake (a food, especially bread or pastry) before finishing the baking process.
meanings.sent1: I will parbake the cookies before adding the chocolate chips.
meanings.sent2: She always parbakes the pie crust to ensure it is perfectly golden.
meanings.sent3: The baker decided to parbake the bread, but forgot to finish baking it later!
meanings.sent4: Parbaking the cake is like giving it a head start before the final bake.
meanings.sent5: Parbaking helps the pastry hold its shape during the baking process.

meanings.definition: The act of partially baking food before finishing the baking process.
meanings.sent1: Parbaking is a common technique in baking to achieve the desired texture.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for a parbaking session before the final bake.
meanings.sent3: The parbaking of the croissants made them look like they were wearing tiny golden hats!
meanings.sent4: The parbaking of the pizza crust gave it a nice crunch when it was fully baked.
meanings.sent5: The chef explained the importance of parbaking in creating flaky pastries.
